abstract: That is what CNBC says about a week that saw the market drop by some 18 percent. Every day brought yet another triple digit loss, the worst being Thursday’s 679-point drop. And as usual, the credit markets were even worse, if that’s possible. My column on Saturday is a meditation on why human beings — knowing what we know about the bouts of financial insanity that led to previous bubbles — can’t seem to prevent them from happening. It turns out that preventing crashes is something we’re just not able to learn from history.
